main event: An object described as a cylindrical mass of flame was observed moving rapidly across the sky over a location north of Saipan.
interesting points: The object was orange colored and about the size of a grapefruit., The object moved straight and level before fading out behind cloud cover., Witnessed by a reliable military observer, Major Richard M. Butler., The event was part of a second sighting documented in a Project Blue Book record., The object did not exhibit any smoke or flame trail during the observation.
location: North of Saipan, Mariana Islands, US
witness description: Major Richard M. Butler, Captain, USRANG, Aircraft Commander
